p: CHIKV and RRV infection typically present with a sudden onset of high fever and severe pain and inflammation in peripheral joints [ 1, 6]. This acute phase lasts for 1 to 2 weeks and often resolves without further complications. However, some disease signs and symptoms, such as joint swelling, joint stiffness, arthralgia, arthritis, and tendonitis/tenosynovitis, can last for months to years in 10–50% of patients [ 7– 13].
